hints.title: Mean-Field Cloning Contraction
hints.content:
280: :label: lem-cloning-contraction-standalone
281: 
282: Under Hypotheses 1-4, for infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
283: 
284: $$
285: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \leq (1 - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}}) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
286: $$
287: 
288: where:
289: $$
290: \beta_{\text{clone}} = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}})
291: $$
292: 
293: and:
294: $$
295: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right] < 0
296: $$
297:

hints.raw_directive:
277: ### 2.3. Main Lemma
278: 
279: :::{prf:lemma} Mean-Field Cloning Contraction
280: :label: lem-cloning-contraction-standalone
281: 
282: Under Hypotheses 1-4, for infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
283: 
284: $$
285: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \leq (1 - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}}) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
286: $$
287: 
288: where:
289: $$
290: \beta_{\text{clone}} = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}})
291: $$
292: 
293: and:
294: $$
295: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right] < 0
296: $$
297: 
298: for $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2$.

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-70
hints.content:
302: :::{prf:proof}
303: 
304: We use entropy-potential decomposition:
305: 
306: $$
307: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) = -H(\mu) + E_\mu[\pi] = -H(\mu) + \int \rho_\mu V_{\text{QSD}}
308: $$
309: 
310: **Part A: Potential Energy Reduction**
311: 
312: **A.1**: The infinitesimal change is:
313: 
314: $$
315: E_{\mu'}[\pi] - E_\mu[\pi] = \tau \int_\Omega S[\rho_\mu](z) V_{\text{QSD}}(z) \, dz + O(\tau^2)
316: $$
317: 
318: **A.2**: Substituting the generator:
319: 
320: $$
321: I := \int_\Omega S[\rho_\mu](z) V_{\text{QSD}}(z) \, dz = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \int_{\Omega \times \Omega} \rho_\mu(z_d) \rho_\mu(z_c) P_{\text{clone}}(V_d, V_c) \Delta V \, dz_d dz_c
322: $$
323: 
324: where $\Delta V = V_{\text{QSD}}(z_c) - V_{\text{QSD}}(z_d)$.
325: 
326: **A.3**: **Key technique - Permutation symmetry**.
327: 
328: The system is invariant under permutations of particles (exchangeability). This means the integral $I$ is symmetric under swapping $z_d \leftrightarrow z_c$.
329: 
330: **Symmetrization**: Write $I$ two ways:
331: 
332: 1. Original: $I = \int \rho_d \rho_c P(V_d, V_c) \Delta V$
333: 2. Swapped: $I = \int \rho_c \rho_d P(V_c, V_d) (-\Delta V)$
334: 
335: Average them:
336: 
337: $$
338: 2I = \int \rho_d \rho_c [P(V_d, V_c) \Delta V - P(V_c, V_d) \Delta V]
339: $$
340: 
341: For $P_{\text{clone}} = \lambda_{\text{clone}} V_c/V_d$ (on $\Omega_1$ where $V_c < V_d$):
342: 
343: $$
344: P(V_d, V_c) - P(V_c, V_d) = \lambda_{\text{clone}}(V_c/V_d - V_d/V_c)
345: $$
346: 
347: Using $V_c/V_d = e^{-\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V}$ (fitness-QSD anti-correlation):
348: 
349: $$
350: \frac{V_c}{V_d} - \frac{V_d}{V_c} = e^{-\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V} - e^{\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V} = -2\sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V)
351: $$
352: 
353: Therefore:
354: 
355: $$
356: I = -\frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \int_{\Omega_1} \rho_d \rho_c \Delta V \sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V) \, dz_d dz_c
357: $$
358: 
359: **A.4**: **Sinh inequality**.
360: 
361: Since $\sinh(z)/z = 1 + z^2/6 + \cdots \geq 1$ for all $z$:
362: 
363: $$
364: \Delta V \sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V) = \lambda_{\text{corr}} (\Delta V)^2 \frac{\sinh(\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V)}{\lambda_{\text{corr}} \Delta V} \geq \lambda_{\text{corr}} (\Delta V)^2
365: $$
366: 
367: Thus:
368: 
369: $$
370: I \leq -\frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}} \lambda_{\text{corr}}}{m_a} \int_{\Omega_1} \rho_d \rho_c (\Delta V)^2 \, dz_d dz_c
371: $$
372: 
373: **A.5**: **Variance bound**.
374: 
375: The integral is related to variance:
376: 
377: $$
378: \int_{\Omega_1} \rho_d \rho_c (\Delta V)^2 \, dz_d dz_c \geq c_1 \cdot \text{Var}_\mu[V_{\text{QSD}}]
379: $$
380: 
381: where $c_1 = 1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}}$ accounts for domain splitting (see Gap #2 resolution).
382: 
383: **A.6**: **Poincaré inequality**.
384: 
385: For log-concave $\pi$ with density $\rho_\pi = e^{-V_{\text{QSD}}}$:
386: 
387: $$
388: \text{Var}_\mu[V_{\text{QSD}}] \geq \lambda_{\text{Poin}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi)
389: $$
390: 
391: This is a standard functional inequality for log-concave measures (Bakry-Émery).
392: 
393: **A.7**: **Combine**:
394: 
395: $$
396: E_{\mu'}[\pi] - E_\mu[\pi] \leq -\tau \beta_{\text{clone}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + O(\tau^2)
397: $$
398: 
399: where:
400: $$
401: \beta_{\text{clone}} = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}})
402: $$
403: 
404: **Part B: Entropy Change**
405: 
406: **B.1**: The infinitesimal entropy change is:
407: 
408: $$
409: H(\mu) - H(\mu') = -\tau \int_\Omega S[\rho_\mu](z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \, dz + O(\tau^2)
410: $$
411: 
412: **B.2**: Decompose into sink and source:
413: 
414: $$
415: = -\tau \int S_{\text{src}}[\rho_\mu] [\log \rho_\mu + 1] + \tau \int S_{\text{sink}}[\rho_\mu] [\log \rho_\mu + 1] + O(\tau^2)
416: $$
417: 
418: **B.3**: **Sink term** (selection):
419: 
420: $$
421: \int S_{\text{sink}}[\rho_\mu](z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \, dz = \int \rho_\mu(z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \bar{P}(z) \, dz
422: $$
423: 
424: where $\bar{P}(z) = \frac{1}{m_a} \int P_{\text{clone}}(V[z], V[z']) \rho_\mu(z') dz' \leq \lambda_{\text{clone}}$.
425: 
426: Bound:
427: 
428: $$
429: \leq \lambda_{\text{clone}} \int \rho_\mu [\log \rho_\mu + 1] = -\lambda_{\text{clone}} H(\mu) + \lambda_{\text{clone}}
430: $$
431: 
432: Using $H(\mu) \geq -\log \rho_{\max}$:
433: 
434: $$
435: \leq \lambda_{\text{clone}} \log \rho_{\max} + \lambda_{\text{clone}}
436: $$
437: 
438: **B.4**: **Source term** (offspring with Gaussian noise).
439: 
440: This is the cross-entropy term:
441: 
442: $$
443: J := -\int S_{\text{src}}[\rho_\mu](z) [\log \rho_\mu(z) + 1] \, dz
444: $$
445: 
446: Rewrite as:
447: 
448: $$
449: J = M \cdot H(\rho_{\text{offspring}}) - M \cdot D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\text{offspring}} \| \rho_\mu) - M
450: $$
451: 
452: where $\rho_{\text{offspring}}(z)$ is the density of offspring after Gaussian noise.
453: 
454: **B.4.1**: **Shannon's Entropy Power Inequality**.
455: 
456: For Gaussian convolution $\rho_{\text{offspring}} = \rho_{\text{clone}} * G_{\delta^2}$:
457: 
458: $$
459: H(\rho_{\text{offspring}}) \geq H(\rho_{\text{clone}}) + \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)
460: $$
461: 
462: **B.4.2**: **De Bruijn's identity for KL divergence**.
463: 
464: Treat Gaussian noise as heat flow: $\rho_t = \rho_{\text{clone}} * G_t$ for $t \in [0, \delta^2]$.
465: 
466: De Bruijn (1959):
467: 
468: $$
469: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu) = -\frac{1}{2} I(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu)
470: $$
471: 
472: where $I(p \| q) = \int p |\nabla \log(p/q)|^2$ is relative Fisher information.
473: 
474: **B.4.3**: **Log-Sobolev Inequality**.
475: 
476: For log-concave $\pi$ (Hypothesis 1), there exists $\kappa > 0$ such that:
477: 
478: $$
479: I(p \| \rho_\mu) \geq 2\kappa D_{\text{KL}}(p \| \rho_\mu)
480: $$
481: 
482: This is the **Bakry-Émery LSI** for log-concave measures.
483: 
484: **B.4.4**: **Exponential contraction**.
485: 
486: Combining de Bruijn and LSI:
487: 
488: $$
489: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu) \leq -\kappa D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\mu)
490: $$
491: 
492: Integrating (Grönwall):
493: 
494: $$
495: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\delta^2} \| \rho_\mu) \leq e^{-\kappa \delta^2} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\mu)
496: $$
497: 
498: i.e.,
499: 
500: $$
501: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\text{offspring}} \| \rho_\mu) \leq e^{-\kappa \delta^2} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_{\text{clone}} \| \rho_\mu)
502: $$
503: 
504: **B.5**: **Combined entropy bound**.
505: 
506: Combining sink and source:
507: 
508: $$
509: H(\mu) - H(\mu') \leq C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
510: $$
511: 
512: where:
513: 
514: $$
515: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right]
516: $$
517: 
518: For $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2 := \frac{1}{2\pi e} \exp(2\log(\rho_{\max}/\rho_{\min})/d)$, we have $C_{\text{ent}} < 0$.
519: 
520: **Part C: Combine**
521: 
522: $$
523: \begin{aligned}
524: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) &= -H(\mu') + E_{\mu'}[\pi] \\
525: &= -[H(\mu) - (H(\mu) - H(\mu'))] + [E_\mu[\pi] + (E_{\mu'}[\pi] - E_\mu[\pi])] \\
526: &\leq -H(\mu) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + E_\mu[\pi] - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + O(\tau^2) \\
527: &= D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
528: \end{aligned}
529: $$
530:
